item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, May 31, 2025 at 3:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Photos taken inside musical instruments (350 points | 22 comments)
2. Surprisingly fast AI-generated kernels we didn't mean to publish yet (209 points | 54 comments)
3. Valkey Turns One: Community fork of Redis (69 points | 17 comments)
4. Mary Meeker's first Trends report since 2019, focused on AI (94 points | 24 comments)
5. Reverse engineering of Linear's sync engine (34 points | 2 comments)
6. Beating Google's kernelCTF PoW using AVX512 (258 points | 79 comments)
7. The 'white-collar bloodbath' is all part of the AI hype machine (297 points | 484 comments)
8. Show HN: Icepi Zero – The FPGA Raspberry Pi Zero Equivalent (98 points | 19 comments)
9. Java Virtual Threads Ate My Memory: A Web Crawler's Tale of Speed vs. Memory (35 points | 11 comments)
10. Microsandbox: Virtual Machines that feel and perform like containers (259 points | 122 comments)
11. Systems Correctness Practices at Amazon Web Services (303 points | 108 comments)
12. Anthropic launches a voice mode for Claude (38 points | 11 comments)
13. Ray Tracing in J (46 points | 7 comments)
14. Silicon Valley finally has a big electronics retailer again: Micro Center opens (143 points | 80 comments)
15. Revenge of the Chickenized Reverse-Centaurs (52 points | 15 comments)
16. Jerry Lewis's "The Day the Clown Cried" discovered in Sweden after 53 years (135 points | 63 comments)
17. Show HN: Circle Crop Image (3 points | 3 comments)
18. StackAI (YC W23) Is Looking for SWR and Tailwind Wizards ( | hide)
19. Show HN: Smart Silence – Remind your iPhone to stay quiet in quiet places (24 points | 1 comment)
20. The radix 2^51 trick (2017) (394 points | 78 comments)
21. How to Run CRON Jobs in Postgres Without Extra Infrastructure (49 points | 17 comments)
22. Every 5x5 Nonogram (16 points | 4 comments)
23. Adam Riess and the Hubble tension (77 points | 65 comments)
24. Copy Excel to Markdown Table (and vice versa) (74 points | 14 comments)
25. Show HN: W++ – A Python-style scripting language for .NET with NuGet support (87 points | 49 comments)
26. De Bruijn notation, and why it's useful (119 points | 31 comments)
27. Show HN: Asdf Overlay – High performance in-game overlay library for Windows (60 points | 16 comments)
28. A Smiling Public Man (36 points | 2 comments)
29. Radio Astronomy Software Defined Radio (Rasdr) (118 points | 7 comments)
30. When will M&S take online orders again? (71 points | 94 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, May 31, 2025 at 3:10 AM UTC
